1Welcome to the 2025 Graduation Ceremony
Welcome to St Vincent Pallotti College Of Engineering Technology, Nagpur’s 2025 Grad-
uation Ceremony, a celebration of our graduates’ achievements. This booklet provides all
necessary information for alumni, faculty, directors, and guests to ensure a smooth and
memorable event. Please review the details carefully.

3Dress Code Guidelines
To maintain the ceremony’s dignity, please adhere to the following dress code require-
ments:
3.1 Alumni
•Attire : Academic gown (black) with cap and tassel, provided by the college.
•Under Gown : Formal attire (e.g., dress shirt, tie, dress pants, or dress/skirt).
•Footwear : Formal shoes (no sneakers or sandals).
3.2 Faculty
•Attire : Faculty academic regalia (speciﬁc to department, provided by college).
•Under Regalia : Business formal attire (suits, dresses, or equivalent).
•Footwear : Polished formal shoes.
3.3 Directors
•Attire : Formal business attire (suits in neutral colors, ties optional).
•Accessories : Name badges provided at registration.
2
3.4 Guests
•Attire : Smart casual (e.g., collared shirts, blouses, dress pants, or skirts).
•Restrictions : No athletic wear, t-shirts, or overly casual clothing.

5Faculty Information
Faculty members play a key role in the ceremony. Below are the details for reporting
times, seating, and stage duties.
5.1 Reporting Time
All faculty must report to the Faculty Lounge (Room 101, Main Auditorium) by 8:00
AM on July 26, 2025, for brieﬁng and regalia distribution.
5.2 Faculty Seating Plan
Faculty are seated in reserved rows at the front of the auditorium:
•Department Heads : Rows 1–2, Block F.
•Other Faculty : Rows 3–5, Block F.
5.3 Stage Duties
•Dr. Anita Desai : Announce graduate names (10:00 AM–11:00 AM).
•Prof. James Lee : Present degrees to Bachelor of Science graduates.
•Dr. Sarah Kim : Present degrees to Bachelor of Arts graduates.
•Prof. Rajesh Kumar : Assist with stage transitions and gown adjustments.
3
6Guest Information
Guests are vital to celebrating our graduates. Please follow these instructions to ensure
a smooth experience.
6.1 Entry Instructions
•Entry Point : Enter through the East Entrance of the Main Auditorium.
•Ticket Requirement : All guests must present a valid ticket (digital or physical)
at the entrance.
•Arrival Time : Doors open at 8:30 AM. Please arrive by 9:30 AM to avoid delays.
6.2 Parking Map Description
•Parking Lots : Use Lots A, B, and C, located east of the Main Auditorium.
•Directions : Follow signs from University Boulevard to designated lots.
•Shuttle Service : Complimentary shuttles run from Lot C to the East Entrance
every 10 minutes from 8:00 AM to 9:30 AM.
•Accessibility : Handicap parking is available in Lot A with accessible shuttle ser-
vice.
6.3 Permitted and Prohibited Items
•Permitted : Small bags (up to 12"x12"), cameras (no tripods), water bottles.
•Prohibited : Large bags, food, alcohol, noisemakers, weapons, or drones.
7General Guidelines
To ensure a respectful and enjoyable ceremony, please adhere to the following:
•Mobile Phone Policy : Phones must be silenced. No calls or loud notiﬁcations
during the ceremony.
•Photography Rules : Personal photography is allowed from seats (no ﬂash). Pro-
fessional photographers will capture oﬃcial moments.
